title: ficihch
author: ficihch
content: Can my account come back again??my bitcointalk account has been hacked by changing the email and password, i got the notification email and it has locked my account for 14 days,so after that what ?I have also contacted recoveries_2021_xxlgg@bitcointalk via my email. but so far no reply.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: ficihch on November 14, 2022, 10:01:59 AMCan my account come back again??It can be even faster if you've posted a bitcoin address in the past and signed a message from that address.Can you name your username?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Have you messaged the email with your signed message with a format like this? I suggest doing so if you have them staked on this thread[1].Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----My account <account> has been hacked/lost. Please reset the email to <email>. The current date is <date>.-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----<insert address here><insert signature here>-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----Here's a detailed [2] steps on to recover your account, just be patient recovery team will reply within days.[1] Stake your Bitcoin address here[2] Hacked accounts recovery team is doing great, Don't just give up yet! by JeromeTash

comments.author: ficihch
comments.body: Unfortunately I have never signed messages in the past for bitcoin addresses.Â  Profile Link ; https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=1059821

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: ficihch on November 14, 2022, 10:31:20 AMUnfortunately I have never signed messages in the past for bitcoin addresses.That's okay, if you have access to one of these addresses below (with a note the addresses were posted before the hack), now you can create a signed message like the format above and post it in this thread.Quote from: Maxre on July 26, 2018, 05:16:14 AM15RpAVXVJorcVbokqDD5s1xN4iDYeibyEZQuote from: Maxre on September 17, 2019, 04:10:28 AM18uLw9HQNYmJ218YMQKNGE7mHDu3ftc11e

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: Quote from: ficihch on November 14, 2022, 10:01:59 AMCan my account come back again??your account woke up 3 days ago. and just changed password this morning, a few hours before you created this thread.if you have sent an email, now you can sign your old wallet as proof of ownership of your account.my suggested use Electrum wallet.if you can't sign your BTC address, it's likely to be difficult to recover your account.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on November 14, 2022, 10:11:11 AM[1] Stake your Bitcoin address hereIn my opinion, that thread should be one thread every member who has crossed the newbie status should take seriously. People shouldn't wait until their account is hacked before they do the needful of simply staking their BTC address there. OP should find a way to sign a message from either of the two accounts user rat03gopoh linked their hacked account and that should be able to solve his hack issue.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on November 14, 2022, 11:00:48 AMAccording to https://ninjastic.space/user/Maxre?addresses, you've posted few Bitcoin and Ethereum address to participate on signature campaign and bounty. Perhaps you could sign message from one of those address and hopefully moderator/admin will help.Yeah he can recover the account in case he can sign the message with those addresses to prove ownership of the account.Quote from: Mpamaegbu on November 14, 2022, 02:03:28 PMIn my opinion, that thread should be one thread every member who has crossed the newbie status should take seriously. People shouldn't wait until their account is hacked before they do the needful of simply staking their BTC address there. OP should find a way to sign a message from either of the two accounts user rat03gopoh linked their hacked account and that should be able to solve his hack issue.If he can sign message with those addresses he can get the access of the account back but most newbies are not familiar with it unless they face the similar issues but they need to check for these thread themselves or say have work around the forum to explore these kind of threads for help in future.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: ficihch on November 14, 2022, 10:01:59 AMCan my account come back again??my bitcointalk account has been hacked by changing the email and password, i got the notification email and it has locked my account for 14 days,so after that what ?I have also contacted recoveries_2021_xxlgg@bitcointalk via my email. but so far no reply.If you've signed a message before with your account then you're lufky there's a possibility that you can have to claim it back by providing thesame process in signing a message provided you've staked your bitcoin address, i think now members will begin to understand the usefulness and benefit of signing a message using your bitcoin address, but I must say this that tou jave also been careless with the handling of your account for it to have been taken by another user, maybe you once use their device to log in or been careless and let a third party ser your password when trying to log in, but i have a strong indication that this must be been through your negligence to security measures.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Mpamaegbu on November 14, 2022, 02:03:28 PMIn my opinion, that thread should be one thread every member who has crossed the newbie status should take seriously. People shouldn't wait until their account is hacked before they do the needful of simply staking their BTC address there.Creating a thread or posting a staked address on that thread won't actually help if the user don't actually know the importance of staking address there. Unless it's a mandatory to make a post of signed message or staked address on that thread to every newbie and up accounts. Why also for those higher rank accounts? Because some of them still doesn't know why it needs to have a signed message posted of the user.Quote from: Doan9269 on November 14, 2022, 02:19:02 PMIf you've signed a message before with your account then you're Unfortunately, he didn't make as what he stated.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on November 14, 2022, 04:08:34 PMQuote from: Mpamaegbu on November 14, 2022, 02:03:28 PM~snipped~Unless it's a mandatory to make a post of signed message or staked address on that thread to every newbie and up accounts.There's no doubt that there are veteran accounts who don't have a staked address yet here. I don't want to believe it's because they don't know how to sign a message from a wallet. I want to believe it's negligence on their part and it's because they think it's not necessary. Again, I don't think there's anything here that's being made compulsory for any member. You can decide to do something or stay away from it. This forum is as decentralised as it can be. Members are allowed to do what they think is best for them provided their actions don't negate the rules and regulations of this forum. Making staking of wallet addresses compulsory most likely will send out a negative signal and suspicion.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: While trying to properly sign a message, you should know that having access to the original email address used to open your account helps to also streamline the recovery process.Ensure that is the account used to send the recovery email, and let it enough time for a response. The process is much faster than it was before, but it would still require a little time for it to be checked and you'll get a response with further instructions.

comments.author: ficihch

comments.author: Lafu
comments.body: Quote from: ficihch on November 15, 2022, 02:40:40 AM-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----My account maxre has been hacked/lost. Please reset the email to masriagusli@gmail.com . The current date is Nov 15 2022.-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----18uLw9HQNYmJ218YMQKNGE7mHDu3ftc11eIH2rnohvpqhsBFWsqBAYTCwI0CaRqIT0wlJhFiUAKllSGFChhwAR+Rl8ttbuNA7SIdtziFyp2bsYzEMLXyYqDOY=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----Is this true?This Signed Message now here is verified with brainwalletx.github.ioVerified Link : https://brainwalletx.github.io/#verify?vrAddr=18uLw9HQNYmJ218YMQKNGE7mHDu3ftc11e&vrMsg=My%20account%20maxre%20has%20been%20hacked%2Flost.%20Please%20reset%20the%20email%20to%20masriagusli%40gmail.com%20.%20The%20current%20date%20is%20Nov%2015%202022.&vrSig=IH2rnohvpqhsBFWsqBAYTCwI0CaRqIT0wlJhFiUAKllSGFChhwAR%2BRl8ttbuNA7SIdtziFyp2bsYzEMLXyYqDOY%3DThe other first signed Message you have posted can be not verified , but the second one here is verified now ! Maybe you missed on the first one something when you posted it here a letter or some.

comments.author: Rizzrack
comments.body: Quote from: ficihch on November 14, 2022, 05:50:22 PM<wrong signed message>Am I the only one who sees a space in the signature ? Between the Q and s highlighted below?If you quote the post and see the BBCode there is no space but if you copy&paste it from the thread the space will be obvious.Might be some weird Firefox bug or a BBCode parser error. idk...Either way first message did not verify...P.S. this is not really related to the topic. Just wanted to know

comments.author: ficihch
comments.body: Thank you all, I just want the latest update that I have received an email for recovery, and it will be done automatically in 7 days.

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: Rizzrack on November 15, 2022, 10:38:52 AMAm I the only one who sees a space in the signature ? Between the Q and s highlighted below?-snip-Might be some weird Firefox bug or a BBCode parser error. idk...It's a forum-related issue.If you type a long word (no spaces) with more than 79 characters, it'll automatically add a space before the next character.Not if it's inside [code][/code] tags.Example:1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789 0Notice that there's a "hidden" space between the last zero and nine. (double-click to highlight)

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: ficihch on November 17, 2022, 05:20:43 AMThank you all, I just want the latest update that I have received an email for recovery, and it will be done automatically in 7 days.They told you that it will take 7 days but it will be done faster than that. The account recovery team is super active in their job.Quote from: nc50lc on November 17, 2022, 07:36:34 AMNot if it's inside [code][/code] tags.Some people post their sign message in quote or in regular text format but it's always recommended to use code tag for posting PGP signature, bitcoin address signed message, any kind of code.
